author: gcolvin
content:
I'm stressing the concept of safety here because it arises often with no agreed definition.

I think I can validate the properties I give with fewer restrictions than EIP-615, and without deprecating dynamic jumps - just taming them.

That is because I think that in actual code the destinations of most dynamic jumps can be limited to a finite set by a simple static analysis. But the proposal remains a Draft until I'm sure.
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3779

And even minimal taming of dynamic jumps would let static versions of subroutines and jumps can ensure safety.
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2315
